comments:
I get the following NPE exceptions periodically when I launch the JVMTI agent with IBM 1.5:


java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.util.internal.TPTPXMLParse.setParser(TPTPXMLParse.java:204)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.queryAgentByProcessID(AgentController.java:489)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.getAgent(AgentController.java:837)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.AgentAvailibilityTester$1.processLaunched(AgentAvailibilityTester.java:135)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl$ProcessEventListener.processLaunched(ProcessImpl.java:785)Couldn't
find class :com.sun.org.apache.xpath.internal.XPathAPI

        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launchAC(ProcessImpl.java:629)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launch(ProcessImpl.java:113)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.AgentAvailibilityTester$2.run(AgentAvailibilityTester.java:162)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.queryAgentByProcessID(AgentController.java:491)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.getAgent(AgentController.java:837)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.AgentAvailibilityTester$1.processLaunched(AgentAvailibilityTester.java:135)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl$ProcessEventListener.processLaunched(ProcessImpl.java:785)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launchAC(ProcessImpl.java:629)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.ProcessImpl.launch(ProcessImpl.java:113)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.jvmti.client.internal.launcher.AgentAvailibilityTester$2.run(AgentAvailibilityTester.java:162)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:797)
To clarify, this is a *client* problem, and does not affect the JVMTI Profilers themselves. It only applies to the scenario when the Eclipse workbench itself is launched under the IBM VM
